material.mattext: …………………. allows the creation of logical links made up of several physical links.
………………….. is a form of link aggregation used in switched networks.
Which of the following is not an advantage of EtherChannel?
Provides resilience because the overall link is viewed as a separate logical connection
Relies on existing switch ports –no need for upgrades
Creates an aggregation viewed as one logical link by STP
Load-balances between links on the same EtherChannnel
If one physical link within EtherChannel goes down, this does not cause a change in the topology and does not require STP recalculation.
…………………….. is implemented by grouping multiple physical ports into one or more logical Channel links.
How many compatibly-configured Ethernet ports can an EtherChannel consist of?
How many EtherChannel does Cisco IOS switch currently support?
Which of the following is not a Port Aggregation Protocol (PAgP) mode?
Which of the following PAgP modes describes a switch actively asking if the other side can or will participate in a port aggregation?
Which of the following PAgP modes describes a channel member without negotiation?
Which of the following PAgP modes describes a channel passively waiting for the other side to participate?
Which of the following is not a Link Aggregation Control Protocol (LACP) mode?
Which of the following LACP modes describes a channel member without negotiation?
Which modes must two switches with a LACP connect be in before a channel can be established?
Which of the following is not a link aggregation configuration guideline?
All interfaces are in the same VLAN
Which command is used to display one line of information per port channel?
Which command is used to provide information about the role of the interface in the EtherChannel?
................enables a wireless device to maintain Internet access without losing a connection.
Some benefits associated to WLAN components are? I. Increased flexibility. II. Increased productivity III. Increased cost and purchasing rate
................... operates in the range of a few feet.
Which of these is an IEEE 802.15 WPAN standard; uses a device-pairing process to communicate over distances up to 0.05 mile (100m)?
Worldwide Interoperability for Microwave Access (WiMAX) has an IEEE of 802.16 WWAN standard that provides wireless broadband access of up to ………………….
. ........................ consists of various corporate, national, and international organizations using service provider cellular access to provide mobile broadband network connectivity.
Very low Frequency(VLF) to Very High Frequency(VHF)
Ultra High Frequency(UHF) to Extremely High Frequency(EHF)
Very low Frequency(VLF) to Ultra High Frequency(UHF)
Low Frequency(LF) to Super High Frequency(SHF)
IEEE Standard 802.11a has a maximum speed of ............and a frequency of .............
IEEE Standard 802.11ac has a maximum speed of ............and a frequency of .............
....................... requires end devices with wireless NICs
In a business wireless solution, access points connect to ...............
In a business wireless solution, clients connect to ................... in a business wireless solution
……………………………. support the clustering of APs without the use of a controller.
....................is a management solution used to simplify the wireless deployment.
APs are .......................... managed from a controller in the cloud.
Cisco Aironet 1600, 2600 and 3600 series are what type of controller-based wireless AP?
Cisco 1552 Series Outdoor Rugged APs belong to what type of APs?
In Ad Hoc Mode of Wireless Topology Models, devices interconnect directly without the use of an AP or wireless router.
…………………… is a variation of the Ad Hoc topology when a smart phone or tablet with cellular data access is enabled to create a personal hotspot.
Frame Subtype 0xOB represents what kind of frame?
Reassociation Response Frame is associated with what kind of Frame Sub type?
........................... is a unique identifier that wireless clients use to distinguish between multiple wireless networks in the same vicinity.
……….............. refers to the 802.11a/b/g/n/ac/ad WLAN standards. APs and wireless routers can operate in a mixed mode; i.e., it can simultaneously use multiple standards.
Which discovering AP mode does AP advertises its service by sending broadcast beacon frames containing the SSID, supported standards, and security settings.?
............................ is a NULL authentication where the wireless client says “authenticate me” and the AP responds with “yes.”
................................ is technique is based on a key that is pre-shared between the client and the AP.
Which of the following is not a wireless threat?
What type of management software is used to detect rogue APs?
What type of GHz band is more prone to interference than the 5 GHz band ?
Which of the following can result in wireless DOS attack?
............................. occurs when an attacker sends a series of “disassociate” commands to all wireless clients.
With ……………………. an attacker takes advantage of the CSMA/CA contention method to monopolize the bandwidth.
To prevent the installation of rogue APs, organizations must use monitoring software to actively monitor the ....................... for unauthorized APs
………………………… is a wireless router that has been connected to a corporate network without explicit authorization and against corporate policy.
. ...........................is a popular wireless MITM attack where an attacker introduces a rogue AP and configures it with the same SSID as a legitimate AP.
Authentication and ......................... are used to secure a wireless network.
Which of the following shared key authentication methods is most secured?
Which of the following shared key authentication methods uses CRC-32 for integrity?
Which of the following shared key authentication methods uses TKIP for encryption?
After the AP or wireless router has been configured, the wireless NIC on the client must remain the same to allow it to connect to the WLAN
Which of the following is not a troubleshooting approach?
In. ....................., the destination is pinged. If the pings fail, verify the lower layers. If the pings are successful, verify the upper layers.
A/An.................... uses a wireless NIC to connect to an infrastructure device such as a wireless router or wireless AP.
A Cisco Aironet AP can use an omnidirectional antenna, a directional antenna, or a yagi antenna to ....................
Multiple BSSs can be joined into an ................................
There should be a ................percent overlap between BSAs in an ESS.
The following are technologies that provide or enhance user access to network resources except?
…………… network reachability is provided by routers and Layer 3 switches which operate in the distribution and core layers.
The following are OSPF network types except?
Which of the following is one of the challenges for OSPF created by multiaccess networks?
…………….. flood the network when OSPF is initialized or when there is a change.
What is the formula used to calculate the number of required adjacencies?
The …………………….. is the solution to managing adjacencies and flooding of LSAs on a multiaccess network.
All other non-DR and non-BDR routers become ……………………..
Which of the following does not result in the change of designated router(DR)?
The OSPF process on the DR fails or is stopped
The multiaccess interface on the DR fails or is shutdown
DROTHERs only send their LSAs to the DR and BDR using the multicast address ………………..
DR uses the multicast address …………………… to send LSAs to all other routers.
Which of the following is not a state of neighbor in a multiaccess networks?
……………….. is a DR or BDR router that is fully adjacent with a non-DR or BDR router.
The router with the highest interface priority is elected as the ……………..
The router with the second highest interface priority is elected as the ………………..
Which of the following is not a way to determine router ID?
Router ID can be manually configured
Router ID can be automatically configured
If not configured, the ID determined by the highest loopback IP address
If no loopbacks, the ID is determined by the highest active IPv4 address
To change the priority, which of the following commands can be used?
To reset an OSPF process, which of the following commands can be used?
Which of the following is not a term given to the router connected to the Internet that is used to propagate a default route?
OSPF Hello and Dead intervals must match, or a neighbor adjacency will occur.
When neighbor authentication has been configured on a router, the router authenticates the …………………… of each routing update packet that it receives.
How many types of authentication does OSPF support?
OSPF supports the following type of authentication except?
Which of the following is the most secure type of authentication OSPF supports?
MD5 authentication can be enabled ………….. for all interfaces or on a per-interface basis.
Which command is used to verify OSPF MD5 authentication?
Which command is used to verify the routing table on a router?
Which of the following is not a reason for OSPF adjacencies not forming?
OSPF delay timers do not match
OSPF network type do not match
The interfaces are not on the same networking
Which of the following is not an OSPF states?
The router should not remain in any states other than …………… for extended periods of time.
Which of the following commands is used to verify configuration information?
Which of the following commands is used to examine the OSPF process ID and router ID.?
To verify the OSPF settings, the ………….. command is used.
The ……………. command verifies networks that are advertised in OSPF.
For an interface to be enabled for OSPF, a matching …………… command must be configured under the OSPF routing process.
The DR and BDR are elected to overcome challenges of …………. in an OSPF network.
When troubleshooting OSPF neighbors, be aware that the …………… states are normal.
